item.title: On the problems of software versioning
item.description: If you’ll indulge me, a metaphor… Software versioning has always seemed to me to be one of the thorniest issues of software engineering. I’ll try to explain why using a metaphor. Think of a large software project you’re familiar with. Now think about some of the details of that software; e.g. the different classes, modules, etc; some of the simpler and more complicated parts of the code; some of the known issues and bugs; any concurrency that might be involved; and of course some of those dark places in the code that are best left untouched.
